title: Har Ki Dun
subtitle: Valley of Gods
about: Har Ki Dun is a cradle-shaped valley steeped in mythology and stunning alpine scenery. Accessible through ancient wooden villages, the trail offers constant views of the Swargarohini peaks and walks through pine forests that surely feel timeless.
seo_title: Har Ki Dun Trek — Valley of Gods
seo_description: A cultural and scenic trek to the Valley of Gods with views of Swargarohini peaks and ancient wooden villages.

trek_places.name: Osla Village
trek_places.short: Ancient wooden village with heavy culture
trek_places.about: Osla is a time-capsule village featuring intricate wooden architecture and a unique temple often associated with Duruyodhana. It's a living museum of mountain culture.
what_to_do: Interact with locals about their legends
Photograph the village against the valley backdrop

trek_places.name: Har Ki Dun Campsite
trek_places.about: The main campsite sits by the Maninda river, right below the imposing Swargarohini peaks. It is a spacious, grassy area that invites long hours of just staring at the mountains.
